{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498076,"name":"Antônio Neto","username":"TheTotonho","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/4bbf92/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:26:00.469Z","cooked":"

Hello CD community!
One of our modules has been getting lost when doing a complete spin.
the sparx marx’s IDs are not wrong it is also not an offset problem.

Our repository: GitHub - pedrohenriquelacerda/YAGSL-PHOTONVISION

Here is a video showcasing the situation:

accounts.google.com

Google Drive: Sign-in

Access Google Drive with a Google account (for personal use) or Google Workspace account (for business use).

We don’t know what to do, do you have any suggestions?

it looks like the drive motor is also repeatedly changing direction, i wonder if the turning is just too slow to follow the setpoint and the optimized module state decides its better to go the other way to reach it.

other things that come to mind are an incrrect gear ratio in a config file or a software limit on the motor position.
